results.title: Gurrawilla
results.creator_credit: Chelsea Studios for the Education Department of Victoria, Ross Campbell and Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Alan Marshall: author and man”.
At one time, Marshall lived with the Aborigines in Arnhem Land, and he tells us how he became known as ‘Gurrawilla’. He also describes in a light-hearted manner tales of his childhood.

results.title: Gurdeep Singh Bains
results.creator_credit: Beverly Shaffer, Kathleen Shannon, Yuki Yoshida and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Gurdeep is a thirteen-year-old Canadian Sikh whose family runs a dairy farm in the southern coastal plain of British Columbia. They have retained their language and religion. Attendance at the Sikh temple, playing soccer with his schoolmates and working on the farm are all part of Gurdeep’s life but sometimes he feels different from other children, because he wears a turban.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Beverly Shaffer, Kathleen Shannon, Yuki Yoshida and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Guppies in biological control of mosquitoes
results.brief_description: Shows how the combined use of biological and chemical measures enabled Japanese scientists to exterminate noxious creatures without exterminating the environment. Biological control of mosquito larvae is contrasted to chemical methods, indicating that guppies are more effective than pesticides.

results.title: Guns for life
results.creator_credit: Jeff Howard, National Film Board of Canada and Alberta Native Communications Society
results.brief_description: As we follow the Native Americans on a hunting trip, the film explores how gun laws are designed to prevent people who may be criminals or irresponsible, from owning a gun. Also covered are safety regulations for those who do have a certificate to won a gun, and the consequences if these are ignored.

results.title: Guns and roses
results.creator_credit: Carole Sklan, Helen Bowman, John Moore and Open Channel Productions
results.brief_description: After enduring years of constant physical and psychological abuse, Melody shot and killed her husband. This film examines the criminal justice system and the conspiracy of silence surrounding domestic violence, through interviews with Melody, her sister, her lawyer, a psychologist specialising in the effects of domestic violence and the supreme court judge who heard her case. Included is an interview with Phil Cleary, M.P. for Wills whose sister was killed by her partner.

results.title: Guns and poses (remix)
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description: This single-channel tape is a remix of the video component of the installation NT YT FREE STYLES. X-PRZ constructs a powerful collage of rap music, authorial text, and iconic visuals to confront the politics of race in the context of the American media. Cokes writes,`Slick and easily legible Pop surface: deploying the Black male media projection as central model, heroic figure, and exploited buffoon of fear-mongers in the media. Moving images: clips from Gangsta rap videos, LA Rebellion 1992, the ‘Jam’ Michael Jackson/Michael Jordon video and other film sources.Sound: Adapted from the ‘Murder was the Case’ soundtrack with works by Dr. Dre, Ice Cube, and Snoop Doggy Dog.’

results.title: Gunpowder man
results.creator_credit: John Richardson and Eastern Suburb's Children's Film Group
results.brief_description: Two boys secretly build a Guy Fawkes. A third boy follows them, discovers their secret and reveals it to his friends. A fight for ownership ensues but stops when the Guy collapses. All join together to re-react it and happily share the firing on Guy Fawkes night.

results.title: Gungarri woman
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Linda Wordie
results.brief_description: Linda is a Gungarri woman, and she has breast cancer. With this diagnosis you see life differently, butterflies, the moon and big cups of tea that become part of life’s healing.

results.title: Gunga Din
results.creator_credit: George Stevens and RKO Radio Pictures
results.brief_description: Gunga Din is rowdy, heroic, exciting, funny and steeped in the romantic tradition of moviemaking. A sergeant in the British army, Cutter is a restless treasure-seeker likely to get everyone into trouble; MacChesney is a typically gruff and aggressive NCO always ready for a fight; and Ballantine is a gentleman who thinks he wants to leave the army to marry his one true love. Gunga Din is an Indian water carrier, a friend in need to the trouble-making trio - a simple man who is destined to become a hero. Based on the poem by Rudyard Kipling the film stars Cary Grant, Victor McLaglen, Douglas Fairbanks, Jr. and Joan Fontaine.
